adr_address: 14 Rue Papillon, 75009 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Streamlined rooms with wood floors & free Wi-Fi in a chic hotel, plus a 24-hour lobby bar.

name: 9Hotel Opéra

reviews.text: We had club room on 3rd floor. It’s was clean and tidy but not much space. staff upgraded us to room on 6th floor which was more spacious. Breakfast was nice but not a great deal of choice

We stayed here for 4 nights after arriving from Amsterdam , and it honestly felt like stepping into a different world, in the best possible way.

From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by a young woman at the front desk who greeted us with a smile and said, “We’ve been expecting you!” It immediately set the tone. She handed us the key to room 506, and it was such a funny coincidence, as we had stayed in room 507 in Amsterdam. When I mentioned that, she smiled and said, “Well, I hope this one is better!” And it really, really was.

Our room on the 5th floor was bright, cozy, and thoughtfully designed. Beige curtains, warm lighting, carefully chosen textures , it was small but full of personality. I especially appreciated the little design details: a wardrobe area built into the wall with accent wallpaper, mismatched but intentional nightstands (one was metal, the other was a painted wooden stump!), and lovely flooring. It felt curated with love, not just furnished.

The lobby downstairs was equally impressive — spacious and stylish, with different seating areas, beautiful couches and armchairs, even a small reading corner with books. There’s also a fridge with drinks at the front desk and a very cozy common area where you can relax or have a coffee.

Location-wise, it was perfect. Just 10 minutes from Gare du Nord (we arrived on the Eurostar), 25 minutes walking to the Louvre, and we even walked all the way to Montmartre and Sacré-Cœur. There’s a bus stop right outside the hotel (line 32, if I remember correctly), and metro stations close by. We barely used public transport because we could walk everywhere!

The daily housekeeping was excellent — clean, tidy, and consistent. There’s also a luggage room, which was super helpful on the day we checked out. Our train wasn’t until the evening, so we left our bags at the hotel, spent a few more hours exploring Paris, then came back, relaxed a bit in the lobby with some coffee, and picked them up before heading to the station.

But more than anything, what stood out was the hospitality. Every single staff member we interacted with was warm, kind, and welcoming. It felt like the kind of place where people genuinely care about your stay.

It’s funny , when I compared reviews beforehand, this hotel and our previous one had almost the same star rating. But they’re not even in the same league. This one was miles better. Clean, well-located, cozy, and with a soul. We stayed 5 days and felt completely at home.

Highly recommend. One of the best stays of our entire trip.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at 9Hotel Opéra for the second time, and I felt it was finally time to share just how wonderful both of my experiences have been. From start to finish, this hotel continues to impress me on every level.

The atmosphere is warm, inviting, and effortlessly stylish, a perfect blend of modern comfort and boutique charm. The rooms are impeccably clean, thoughtfully designed, and the bed is one of the most comfortable I’ve slept in during my travels. Everything feels high quality, from the linens to the little details that make your stay feel special.

Each morning started with a delicious breakfast, fresh, varied, and beautifully presented. It really sets the tone for the day. Whether you’re into pastries, fresh fruit, or something more hearty, there’s something for everyone.

But what truly sets 9Hotel Opéra apart is the exceptional staff. Every team member I interacted with was professional, kind, and genuinely dedicated to making guests feel welcome. A special mention goes to Hanane, the Front Office Manager, and Séverine, the Director, both of whom embody warmth, hospitality, and attention to detail. Their personal touch made a real difference in my stay, I felt more like a guest in someone’s home than a customer in a hotel.

Having stayed twice now, I can confidently say that 9Hotel Opéra has become my go-to hotel in Paris. Whether you’re visiting for business or leisure, I wholeheartedly recommend it for anyone looking for comfort, service, and a true Parisian boutique experience. I’m already looking forward to my next visit! Inès
Nice hotel and staff, good for the locations, rooms are small but good enough for two three days!
I was not sure what to expect as the average is 3.9 on Google. Far from true, room was nice and a good size, the air conditioner saved my life and the staff was nice. My room was clean.
